author: mklement0
body:
An (adapted) copy of [this uservoice issue](https://windowsserver.uservoice.com/forums/301869/suggestions/11088336) first reported by @PetSerAl  in 2014:

Using a `dynamicparam` block in an advanced function causes invocations with the `-PipelineVariable` common parameter to fail.

Steps to reproduce
------------------

```powershell

function foo {
  [CmdletBinding()]
  param()
  dynamicparam { }
  process { 'hi' }
}

foo -PipelineVariable bar
```

Expected behavior
-----------------

```none
hi
```

Actual behavior
---------------

The following error is reported:

```none
foo : Cannot retrieve the dynamic parameters for the cmdlet. Object reference not set to an instance of an object.
...
```

Note that it doesn't make a difference whether the `dynamicparam` block is empty or not.

Environment data
----------------

```powershell
PowerShell Core v6.0.2 on macOS 10.13.3
PowerShell Core v6.0.2 on Ubuntu 16.04.3 LTS
PowerShell Core v6.0.2 on Microsoft Windows 10 Pro (64-bit; v10.0.15063)
Windows PowerShell v5.1.15063.674 on Microsoft Windows 10 Pro (64-bit; v10.0.15063)
```

comments.author: mklement0
comments.body:
@MaximoTrinidad: 

Here's a relatively simple working example that defines a dynamic `-baz` parameter that uses a validate-set attribute to only accept value `1`, `2`, or `3`.
As you'll see,  the problem with `-PipelineVariable` persists; try `foo -pv var`.

```powershell
function foo {
    [CmdletBinding()] # !! Required for DynamicParam {} to work properly.
    param([string] $bar)
    DynamicParam
    {
        # Create the dynamic parameter's attributes.
        # -- Create a [Parameter()] attribute.
        $paramAttr = [System.Management.Automation.ParameterAttribute]::new()
        # Set properties such as .ParameterSetName, .Position, .ValueFromPipeline, ...
        $paramAttr.Position = 1
        # -- Create a [ValidateSet()] attribute with a set of permissive values.
        $validateSetAttr = [System.Management.Automation.ValidateSetAttribute]::new(1, 2, 3)

        # Create the dynamic parameter with its name, type, and attributes...
        $dynParam1 = [System.Management.Automation.RuntimeDefinedParameter]::new('baz', [int],
            ($paramAttr, $validateSetAttr)
        )

        # ... and add it to a RuntimeDefinedParameterDictionary to return.
        $paramDict = [System.Management.Automation.RuntimeDefinedParameterDictionary]::new()
        $paramDict.Add($dynParam1.Name, $dynParam1)
        return $paramDict
    }
    end {
        $bar
        $baz
    }
}
```

title: Using a dynamicparam block in an advanced function causes invocations with the -PipelineVariable common parameter to fail
